com.javax0.jdsl.analyzers

Interface SourceCode

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StringSourceCode

    public interface SourceCode
    SourceCode represents the character stream of the program source code. Implementation of SourceCode should be immutable objects. As the input source is consumed new SourceCode objects are returned by the analyzers. Even though the underlying character stream may be the same in a very similar way as String is implemented in the Java language.

    For a sample implementation have a look at StringSourceCode.

    Author:
    Peter Verhas

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char charAt(int i)
      Get the character at the position i.
      int length()
      Get the number of characters that are available in the source code.
      SourceCode rest(int i)
      Get source code that represent the characters that follow the first i characters of the original (this) source code.

    • Method Detail

      • charAt

        char charAt(int i)
        Get the character at the position i. Indexing starts with zero.

      • length

        int length()
        Get the number of characters that are available in the source code.

      • rest

        SourceCode rest(int i)
        Get source code that represent the characters that follow the first i characters of the original (this) source code.
